DataElement.preferredName: Head and Neck Surgery Specific Complication Airway Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the kind of  airway complication specific to head and neck surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Head and Neck Surgery Specified Complication Airway
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any surgery involving a structure in the head and neck region._Clearly and explicitly stated._Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure._The part of the respiratory system between the nose or mouth and the lungs.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Head and Neck Surgery Specified Complication
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any surgery involving a structure in the head and neck region.:Clearly and explicitly stated.:Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.

Concepts.definition: Any surgery involving a structure in the head and neck region.
Clearly and explicitly stated.
Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.

Property.preferredDefinition: The part of the respiratory system between the nose or mouth and the lungs.

Concepts.definition: The part of the respiratory system between the nose or mouth and the lungs.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results or effects (does not include CTC Adverse Events) of therapeutic agents or procedures administered to the patient.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Princess Margaret as requested by D.Laurence. mc 6/15/16

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure that creates a fistula between the trachea and esophagus in a patient who has previously undergone a total laryngectomy for the purpose of inserting a voice prosthesis to allow for esophageal speech.: A finding indicating the presence of cellular necrosis in a tissue specimen.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure that creates a fistula between the trachea and esophagus in a patient who has previously undergone a total laryngectomy for the purpose of inserting a voice prosthesis to allow for esophageal speech.
A finding indicating the presence of cellular necrosis in a tissue specimen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An erosion through the tracheal wall into an artery.: An erosion through the tracheal wall into an artery.

Concepts.definition: An erosion through the tracheal wall into an artery.
An erosion through the tracheal wall into an artery.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An unforeseen and unplanned event or circumstance frequently causing loss or injury.: The process of removing a tracheostomy tube.: A 2-inch- to 3-inch-long curved metal or plastic tube placed in a surgically created opening (tracheostomy) in the windpipe to keep it open.

Concepts.definition: An unforeseen and unplanned event or circumstance frequently causing loss or injury.
The process of removing a tracheostomy tube.
A 2-inch- to 3-inch-long curved metal or plastic tube that is placed in a surgically created opening (tracheostomy) in the windpipe to maintain patency.

PermissibleValues.value: Vocal cord paralysis or paresis (unilateral or bilateral)
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Unilateral Or Bilateral Paresis Or Vocal Cord Paralysis

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Unilateral Or Bilateral Paresis Or Vocal Cord Paralysis
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Involving only one part or side.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Affecting both sides of the body, or a matched pair of organs.: A slight or incomplete paralysis.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Paralysis of the muscles of one or both vocal cords. Signs and symptoms include hoarseness, weak voice, dyspnea, and coughing. Affected individuals are at risk for aspiration pneumonia.

Concepts.definition: Involving only one part or side.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Affecting both sides of the body or a matched pair of organs.
A slight or incomplete paralysis.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Paralysis of the muscles of one or both vocal cords. Signs and symptoms include hoarseness, weak voice, dyspnea, and coughing. Affected individuals are at risk for aspiration pneumonia.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Blockage of air flow in the respiratory tract.

Concepts.definition: Blockage of air flow in the respiratory tract.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Be specific about something; define clearly.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Blockage of the normal flow of the contents of an anatomical passageway.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: A physical quality in which the entity or structure is not appropriately or correctly placed.: A 2-inch- to 3-inch-long curved metal or plastic tube placed in a surgically created opening (tracheostomy) in the windpipe to keep it open.

Concepts.definition: Blockage of the normal flow of the contents of an anatomical passageway.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A physical quality in which the entity or structure is not appropriately or correctly placed.
A 2-inch- to 3-inch-long curved metal or plastic tube that is placed in a surgically created opening (tracheostomy) in the windpipe to maintain patency.

PermissibleValues.value: TEP catheter dislodgement causing loss of puncture
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Tracheoesophageal Puncture Dislodged Catheter Loss of Stoma

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Tracheoesophageal Puncture Dislodged Catheter Loss of Stoma
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure that creates a fistula between the trachea and esophagus in a patient who has previously undergone a total laryngectomy for the purpose of inserting a voice prosthesis to allow for esophageal speech.: A catheter that has moved from its intended location.: The unplanned closing of a stoma.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure that creates a fistula between the trachea and esophagus in a patient who has previously undergone a total laryngectomy for the purpose of inserting a voice prosthesis to allow for esophageal speech.
A catheter that has moved from its intended location.
The unplanned closing of a stoma.
